li.span: 2. This recommended funding is subject to compliance by your company with the terms and timeframes detailed below.

ol.li: 2.1 Learners are to commence their programme(s) by no later than 01 February
2.2 Documentation is to be submitted on INSETA templates, and as per the timeframes and prescribed submission process. Early submissions are encouraged
2.3 Non-compliance to the terms and timeframes shall result in the INSETA withdrawal of the recommended funding, without further notice.
2.4 In the event the submitted information and/or documentation is incomplete and/or inaccurate, the whole batch shall be returned to the submitter to correct and resubmit to INSETA within 72 hours.
2.5 Funding is subject to the INSETA monitoring and evaluation process
2.6 You agree to provide information as required by INSETA for the purposes of reporting to the Department of Higher Education and Training, as well as other statutory stakeholders.
2.7 In all instances the training institution must be accredited by the relevant Quality Assurance Entity and be accredited to offer the programme applied for.
2.8 Kindly quote the reference number in all correspondence.

li.span: 3. Within thirty calendar days of the date of this letter, submit to INSETA

ol.li:
3.1 Letter of Authorisation: A letter confirming the details of the person authorised to enter into contractual agreements with INSETA on behalf of the company.
Details must include the Full Name(s), Surname, Designation, Email address, and Contact number of the authorised person, and must be on the company letterhead.

3.2 Letter of Confirmation of
3.2.1 the Recommended Number of Learners as detailed in (1) above
3.2.2 the intended date on which learners will commence with their learning programme

li.span: 4. Four (4) calendar weeks prior to learner commencement on the learning programme, submit to INSETA

ol.li:
4.1 Where the learnership is not an INSETA learnership, submit a letter from the training institution,
providing the training institution’s particulars and the details of the learnership(s)

4.2 Where the training institution is a private entity, submit
4.2.1 Proof of the training institution’s accreditation by the relevant Quality Assurance Entity
4.2.2 Proof that the training institution has permission (scope) from the relevant Quality Assurance Entity to deliver the learnership(s)

4.3 Learner Agreements and Documentation submission
4.3.1 A complete, duly signed, and dated INSETA Learnership Programme agreement between the learner, the training institution, and the employer, detailing the learning programme title and registration code as well as clear start (commencement) and end dates of learners.
4.3.2 Certified copy of learners’ Identity document
4.3.3 A duly completed, signed, and dated fixed term employment contract between the learner and the employer.
4.3.4 Certified copy of learner’s highest qualification
4.3.5 Complete and accurate SETMIS Upload Template
4.3.6 Protection of Personal Information Act (POPIA) declaration completed, duly signed, and dated by each learner
4.3.7 Confirmation of disability if applicable

t.p: Submissions and enquiries are to be sent to
